    • Constructor Detail

      • LayeredSchema

        public LayeredSchema(com.yahoo.bullet.typesystem.Schema schema)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        schema - The Schema to use.

    • Method Detail

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer(com.yahoo.bullet.typesystem.Schema newSchema,
                     Map<String,String> newAliases)
        Adds a new layer to the top of this, pushing every layer one deeper. Note that if this layered schema had layers on top, their depths will not be adjusted. It is recommended to add layers from the top.
        Parameters:
        newSchema - The new Schema to add to the top layer.
        newAliases - The new Map of aliases to add to the top layer.

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Locks this LayeredSchema, preventing access to all layers below.

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Unlocks this LayeredSchema, allowing access to layers below.

      • depth

        public int depth()
        Gets the current depth of this LayeredSchema. Depth is defined starting at 0 for the top layer and increases as you go deeper.
        Returns:
        The depth of this layer.

      • findField

        public LayeredSchema.FieldLocation findField(String field,
                                             int minimumDepth)
        Searches for the given field from this layer. The minimum depth parameter can be provided to ensure that the field, if found, is at that depth or greater. The depth is the depth of this layered schema as defined by depth(). This can be used to skip layers for the search.
        Parameters:
        field - The field to search for.
        minimumDepth - The minimum (whole number) for the depth to find the field from.
        Returns:
        A LayeredSchema.FieldLocation for the field. It is non-null. If the schema does not exist, the type will be Type.UNKNOWN. If field is not found, the type will be be Type.NULL.

      • findField

        public LayeredSchema.FieldLocation findField(String field)
        Searches for the given field in this layer and below.
        Parameters:
        field - The field to search for.
        Returns:
        A LayeredSchema.FieldLocation for the field. It is non-null. If the schema does not exist, the type will be Type.UNKNOWN. If field is not found, the type will be be Type.NULL.

      • getField

        public com.yahoo.bullet.typesystem.Schema.Field getField(String field)
        Searches for the given field in this layer and below.
        Parameters:
        field - The field to search for.
        Returns:
        The Schema.Field or null if not found.

      • getType

        public com.yahoo.bullet.typesystem.Type getType(String field)
        Searches for the type of the given field in this layer and below.
        Parameters:
        field - The field to search for.
        Returns:
        The Type or Type.NULL if not found, or if the schema is absent, Type.UNKNOWN.

      • hasField

        public boolean hasField(String field)
        Checks to see if the given field exists in this layer or below.
        Parameters:
        field - The field to search for.
        Returns:
        A boolean denoting if the field exists or not.

      • addField

        public void addField(String field,
                     com.yahoo.bullet.typesystem.Type type)
        Adds a new field to the Schema at this layer.
        Parameters:
        field - The name of the field to add.
        type - The Type of the field to add.

      • getFieldNames

        public Set<String> getFieldNames()
        Retrieves the names of all the fields in this and accessible layers below.
        Returns:
        The Set of field names after flattening.

      • getExtraneousAliases

        public Set<String> getExtraneousAliases()
        Retrieves field names that have aliases but do not exist in the schema at each accessible layer.
        Returns:
        The Set of extraneous aliases.
